title: Blue Book Magazine

renewed-contributions.title: The Shocker
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title as 'The Shacker'.  I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.title: Big Enough
renewed-contributions.note: No renewal was found in CCE specifically for this part (unlike the later two), but the 1959 renewal for the 1931 book of the same title may cover this part as well.

renewed-contributions.title: Adventures With Clubfoot: Mystery of the Gold Box
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title as 'Disaster at the Inn'.  I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.title: Adventures of Clubfoot: Mystery of the Goldbox
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title as 'The Last Throw'.  I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title as 'The Knave of Diamonds'. I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.note: Title as given on issue cover. CCE gives title as 'Ill Wind'.

renewed-contributions.title: I Want to See the Sky
Amerigo Vespucci: The Mystery of America's Godfather
renewed-contributions.note: Author as given in FictionMags and a related CCE entry.  The July-December 1969 CCE also files this under Carl Zollmann, but that appears to be an error.

renewed-contributions.title: Amerigo Vespucci: The Mystery of America's Godfather
renewed-contributions.note: Author as given in FictionMags and a related CCE entry.  The July-December 1969 CCE also files this under Carl Zollmann, but that appears to be an error.

renewed-contributions.title: The Street of the Crying Woman
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Daniel Mainwaring writing under a pseudonym. The renewal mentioned in CCE is for the book of the same title, but also mentions the magazine version and may cover it.

renewed-contributions.title: Johnny Jones and the Wishing Well
The Hill of the Terrified Monk
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Daniel Mainwaring writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: The Story of Pooch and Sundry Other People
renewed-contributions.note: There was no renewal filed for this particular contribution, but a 1971 renewal for the 1944 book 'Death Strikes at Heron House' says it was first published in the September 1943 issue of Blue Book magazine. That renewal may cover this serial installment, a predecessor of the only work by McIntyre in that issue mentioned in FictionMags.

renewed-contributions.title: The Story of Pooch and Sundry Other People
renewed-contributions.note: There was no renewal filed for this particular contribution, but a 1971 renewal for the 1944 book 'Death Strikes at Heron House' says it was first published in the September 1943 issue of Blue Book magazine. That renewal may cover this serial installment, a predecessor of the only work by McIntyre in that issue mentioned in FictionMags.

renewed-contributions.title: The Story of Pooch and Sundry Other People
renewed-contributions.note: A 1971 renewal for the 1944 book 'Death Strikes at Heron House' says it was first published in this issue of Blue Book magazine. That renewal may cover this serial installment, the only work by McIntyre in this issue mentioned in FictionMags.

renewed-contributions.title: Mother's Little Helper
renewed-contributions.note: CCE states this was published in Blue Book, but FictionMags and some inconstencies in CCE suggest it was instead published in Redbook, in the issue for the same month. I have not examined the issues in question.

renewed-contributions.title: Judy Pre-Judges
renewed-contributions.note: CCE states this was published in Blue Book, but FictionMags and some inconstencies in CCE suggest it was instead published in Redbook, in the issue for the same month. I have not examined the issues in question.

renewed-contributions.title: The Mystery of the Missing Face
The Mystery of the Missing Hands
The Mystery of the Mongolian Fold
The Princess of Burma
renewed-contributions.note: Author as given in FictionMags and in CCE as the name of the author-claimant.  The January-June 1973 CCE also files this under Hans J. Morgenthau, but that appears to be an error.

renewed-contributions.title: I've Got Mine
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title of Hubler's contribution to this issue as 'Semper Fidelis'.  I have not checked the issue to see what appears there, but CCE also notes this is the title of a book previously published in this issue.

renewed-contributions.title: This is the Love I Cannot Stop
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title as 'Deep Where You Cannot See'. I have not checked the issue to see what appears there.

renewed-contributions.title: Plunder of the Sun
renewed-contributions.note: While CCE does not mention a renewal specifically for this contribution, a 1976 renewal for the 1949 book of the same title mentions its earlier condensed publication in Blue Book magazine, and may cover this story.

renewed-contributions.title: The Lost Sitting Bull
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE. FictionMags gives title as 'There Were Two Sitting Bulls'.  I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.title: Very Cold for May
renewed-contributions.note: Copyright database renewal says this was in the May issue, but it is mentioned on the April 1950 cover (and not in the May 1950 FictionMags listing).  I have not examined the issue contents.

renewed-contributions.title: The Long Carry
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Judson P. Philips writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Very Cold for May
renewed-contributions.note: Copyright database renewal says this was in the May issue, but it is mentioned on the April 1950 cover (and not in the May 1950 FictionMags listing).  I have not examined the issue contents.

renewed-contributions.title: The Girl on the Lonely Road
The Aleutian Blue Mink Coat
renewed-contributions.note: Mentioned in, and most likely covered by, the 1979 renewal for the 1951 book 'The Aleutian Blue Mink'.

renewed-contributions.title: How it Really Happened
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Judson P. Philips writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Round Trip to the Moon
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in copyright renewal database. FictionMags gives title as 'Moon Flight'.  I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.title: Wagons West
renewed-contributions.note: Author given on cover as Samuel Hopkins Adams; renewal database has two records for this story, one crediting Adams and one crediting Charlotte Armstrong.  I am not sure whether Armstrong had a hand in this story, or if one of the renewal records is erroneous.

renewed-contributions.title: Wells of Destiny
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Clifton Adams writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: The Man With the Golden Hand
Margin of Terror
renewed-contributions.note: Mentioned in, and most likely covered by, the 1981 renewal for the 1953 book of the same title.

renewed-contributions.title: This Man Wyatt
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Henry Wilson Allen writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: The Big Money
renewed-contributions.note: Mentioned in, and most likely covered by, the 1982 renewal for the 1954 book of the same title.

renewed-contributions.note: The 1983 renewal for the 1955 book of the same title may cover this column.

renewed-contributions.title: Two Soldiers
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in copyright database. FictionMags gives title as 'One of Us'.  I have not checked the issue to see what title is used there.

renewed-contributions.title: The Power
renewed-contributions.note: This may reflect an erroneous duplicate renewal record in the copyright database.

comment: Pick up with 'Lone gun' (record 58) in the ascending-date sort of the title search for 'Bluebook'
additional-notes: A 1981 renewal for the 1953 book 'China Coaster' by Don Smith may have been filed too late to cover the version that appeared in the November 1952 issue of Blue Book. However, there is a renewal for the issue in which it appeared.

A 1982 renewal for the 1954 book 'The Man Inside' by M. E. Chaber may have been filed too late to cover the condensed version that appeared in the December 1953 issue of Blue Book. However, there is a renewal for the issue in which it appeared.
